frameDefinitions: In the Appeal stage of the criminal process the Convict or his or her Representative applies to a higher Court to reverse the Decision of the lower court on certain Grounds. '

This frame is concerned with the idea that people (Participant_1, Participant_2, or Participants) participate in an organized, rule-governed activity (the Competition) in order to achieve some advantageous outcome (often the Prize).
A physical entity, construed as a point-Sound_source, emits a Sound.
In this frame a Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.
An Agent uses a Resource which is consumed and unavailable for future use.
An Entity (generally food) is exposed to a Heat_source whose Temperature may also be specified.
frameExamples: The defense plans to <t>appeal</t> the court's decision on the grounds that the judge violated Code 81.b .
We <t>exhausted</t> our supply of oil long ago.
Bacon was <t>frying</t> in the pan, and a great heap of eggs already lay steaming on a plate.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Convict</fen> is the individual convicted of the crime who may make an appeal on her or his behalf.
The <fen>Representative</fen> applies to a higher court on behalf of the <fen>Convict</fen>.
The <fen>Decision</fen> is the ruling handed down by the first court.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which a <fen>Convict</fen> or <fen>Representative</fen> appeals.
This role identifies the first (or only) participant in a competition.
This role identifies the second participant in a competition.
This role is used for plural NP participants in a competition.
This role is used for the name of the competition.
The period of time when the <fen>Competition</fen> occurs.

Where the event takes place. 
A constituent tagged as <fen>Place</fen> may require annotation on a secondary FE-layer.

The frame element <fen>Sound_source</fen> is assigned to a constituent referring to a physical entity which emits a sound. Such an entity must have an appropriately complex internal structure such that it can create a sound. For example, a machine or some other thing with moving parts can create sound by itself.

The frame element <fen>Sound</fen> is incorporated in the meaning of the verbs of this frame. Otherwise, this role is assigned to NPs which actually refer to a sound in the presence of the target. This typically occurs when the target is a verb used as a modifier in its <ment>-ing</ment> form, e.g.:
An event in which one or more <fen>Sound_source</fen>s participate and which is accompanied by <fen>Sound</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Noisy_event</fen> occurs.

The location of the <fen>Sound_source</fen>. This role differs from <fen>Location_of_source</fen> only in terms of point of view; the latter role implies a point of view that is not on the <fen>Sound_source</fen>.
The <fen>Speaker</fen>, as in other communication frames, is generally an External Argument.
In this frame the <fen>Addressee</fen> can either occur as an NP Object (usually with a following complement clause) or as a PP Complement of verbs or nouns.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the content of the request that can be expressed as a quote, in a finite or non-finite clausal Complement, an NP Object or PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>. The <fen>Medium</fen> is frequently expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>on</ment> or <ment>in</ment>.
The interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the request.
The <fen>Resource</fen> is exhausted over time by being used.
The <fen>Agent</fen> uses the <fen>Resource</fen>.
The degree to which the Resource is depleted by the Agent.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> exhausts the <fen>Resource</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> exhausts the <fen>Resource</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> (often a food item)  that absorbs heat.
The <fen>Container</fen> that holds the <fen>Entity</fen> that absorbs the heat.
This role identifies the object that directly supplies heat to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the heat absorption takes place.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the heat application occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Jo</fex> played the lottery every day.
Jo played <fex>Leslie</fex> at tennis.
<fex>Jo and Leslie</fex> played tennis.
Jo played <fex>in the foosball tournament</fex>
First layer: John's first competition <fex>at Wimbledon</fex> astonished the crowd.
<fex>The wind</fex> howled.
The branches made a rattling <fex>sound</fex>.
<fex>The conversations</fex> droned on
It's going to beep again <fex>in two minutes</fex>.
A bat squeaked <fex>over our heads</fex>.
<fex>The judge</fex> ordered the plaintiff to return the money.
The child implored <fex>her parents</fex> to let her stay up late.
<fex>'I'd like an extension,'</fex> begged Pat.
The parents of the missing child made an appeal <fex>on television</fex>.
I urged him to concede <fex>yesterday</fex>.
Their program used up <fex>very little</fex> processing power.
<fex>Bacon</fex> frying in the pan and scenting the air
Five fat sausages were frying <fex>in the pan</fex>
Food was placed to sizzle <fex>on the barbecue </fex>.
<fex>Five minutes ago</fex>the eggs weren't boiling yet.
<fex>In the kitchen</fex> the meat sizzled in the oven and a big pan of potatoes stood on the hob
